title: Finite Sets
content: Membership in the class of finite sets can be expressed in many ways.

blocks.name: rp-isfinite5
blocks.content: A set is said to be finite if it can be put in one-to-one correspondence with all the natural numbers between 1 and some ` n e. NN0 ` . (Contributed by Richard Penner, 3-Mar-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm rp-isfinite5(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wrex(s0, cn0, wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  impbii(wcel(c0, cfn), wrex(s0, cn0, wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0)))
  sylibr(wcel(c0, cfn), wrex(s0, cn0, wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0)), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0))))
  mpsyl(wcel(c0, cfn), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0))), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), universe), wa(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0)))

  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cfv(chash, c0)), wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0))
  eleq1(cv(s0), cfv(chash, c0), cn0)

  sylibr(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0)), wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0))
  sylancom(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))))
  syl2anr(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)))), wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), cv(s0)))
  eqcomd(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cen, c0))
  hasheni(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), c0)
  hashfz1(cv(s0))
  mpsyl(wa(wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)))), wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), cv(s0))), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), universe), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cv(s0)))

  syl5(wcel(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), universe), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cv(s0)), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), wceq(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))))

  entr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), c0)

blocks.name: rp-isfinite6
blocks.content: A set is said to be finite if it is either empty or it can be put in one-to-one correspondence with all the natural numbers between 1 and some ` n e. NN ` . (Contributed by Richard Penner, 10-Mar-2020.)
